author: The Politics Desk
description: With President Donald Trump’s megabill now signed into law, members of Congress are turning their attention to their next big government funding showdown.
title: The next big fight on Capitol Hill is brewing: From the Politics Desk

author: Kaitlin Sullivan
description: Fungal infections are getting harder to treat as they grow more resistant to available drugs, according to research published Wednesday in The Lancet Microbe
title: Fungal infections are getting harder to treat

author: Adam Edelman
description: Republican Texas Gov. Greg Abbott said Wednesday that tackling redrawing the state's congressional maps would be part of an special legislative session later this summer as Republicans seek to hold on to their narrow U.S.
title: Texas to consider redrawing congressional maps during special legislative session

author: Kimmy Yam
description: In a rare federal trial Wednesday in which university groups are challenging the Trump administration’s efforts to deport pro-Palestinian activists, the Department of Homeland Security shared how it got the names of some of the students who were targeted for deportation.
title: DHS used anonymous pro-Israel site to target activists for deportation, agency says in court

author: Reuters
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 (Reuters) — OpenAI is close to releasing an AI-powered web browser that will challenge Alphabet’s (GOOGL
title: OpenAI to release web browser in challenge to Google Chrome

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A California mom charged in the death of her toddler was getting lip filler injections when she allegedly left the child in her car amid temperatures that topped 100 degrees, court records obtained Wednesday show
title: 1-year-old dies after being left in hot car while mom was getting lip filler, police say

author: Sahil Kapur
description: President Donald Trump’s push for Republicans to bypass Democrats and claw back $9.4 billion in approved spending has ignited a new fight in Congress that could upend the normally bipartisan government funding process.
title: Trump's push to claw back funding ignites a fight that threatens a government shutdown

author: Reuters
description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol returned to jail on Thursday after a court approved a warrant sought by prosecutors investigating his attempt to impose martial law last year.
title: Former South Korean president jailed again in probe of attempt to impose martial law

author: Dan Mangan, CNBC
description: The case involves Oak View Group, Tim Leiweke and Legends Hospitality, whose minority owners include the New York Yankees and the Dallas Cowboys.
title: Sports executive charged with bid rigging in Texas arena project

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday he planned to hit Brazil with a 50% tariff, in part due to the treatment of its former president and his political ally, Jair Bolsonaro
title: Trump hits Brazil with 50% tariff, in part due to trial of ally Jair Bolsonaro

description: Sen. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) speaks with NBC News Capitol Hill Correspondent Julie Tsirkin after he voted to pass President Trump’s tax and spending plan despite opposing its sweeping cuts to Medicaid.
title: Sen. Josh Hawley says he’ll make sure Medicaid cuts in Trump bill he voted for ‘never take effect’

author: Annie Palmer, CNBC
description: U.S. online sales jumped 9.9% year over year to $7.9 billion on Tuesday, the kickoff of Amazon’s Prime Day megasale, according to Adobe Analytics
title: Retailers log $7.9 billion in online sales in first 24 hours of Prime Day

author: Laura Strickler
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has been exerting more direct control over the agency, which President Trump has talked about "getting rid of."
title: After Texas floods, questions about FEMA's future loom large

author: Brooke Sopelsa
description: Baylor University, a Baptist institution in Waco, Texas, announced Wednesday that it would rescind its acceptance of a $643,000 grant that it had recently been awarded to study the inclusion of women and LGBTQ people in the church.
title: Baylor University to return $643,000 LGBTQ-inclusion grant

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Major League Baseball will use the automated ball-strike challenge system during the All-Star Game on July 15 in Atlanta, a MLB source confirmed to NBC News.
title: MLB will use automated ball-strike challenge system in upcoming All-Star game

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: During a meeting with the leaders of several African nations at the White House, President Donald Trump took a pause Wednesday to compliment Liberian President Joseph Boakai’s English.“Well, thank you,” Trump said after Boakai spoke.
title: Trump says the president of Liberia, where English is the official language, speaks 'such good English'

author: Elizabeth Chuck
description: Panera has settled three remaining lawsuits it faced over its caffeinated Charged Lemonade, a beverage that had been blamed for multiple deaths and injuries.
title: Panera settles remaining lawsuits over its highly caffeinated Charged Lemonade

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Federal Reserve officials diverged at their June meeting about how aggressively they would be willing to cut interest rates, split between concerns over tariff-fueled inflation and signs of labor market weakness and economic strength
title: Most Fed officials see rate cuts coming, but opinions vary widely on how many, minutes show

author: The Associated Press
description: You may be seeing elaborate shower cleansing routines on social media: daily exfoliation, double cleansing, loads of scented body scrubs and shower oils.
title: A good shower is a simple shower, no matter what influencers recommend

author: David K. Li
description: A New York City co-op board rejected influencer Livvy Dunne's bid to buy Babe Ruth's one-time apartment, turning aside her nearly $1.6 million offer of cash, the social media star and former college gymnast said Tuesday
title: Livvy Dunne says co-op board rejected her bid to buy Babe Ruth's old NYC apartment

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: As Republicans face criticism for cutting Medicaid, Hawley tried to shift the focus to a less-noticed part of the law that will benefit victims of nuclear waste.
title: After voting for Trump's megabill, GOP Sen. Josh Hawley wants to prevent a key Medicaid cut from taking effect

author: Jason Abbruzzese
description: The videos have become a crucial window into the U.S. government’s aggressive efforts to find and apprehend undocumented immigrants.
title: How user-generated videos on social media brought Trump's immigration crackdown to America's screens

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: The Trump administration sued California for allegedly violating federal law with policies that allow trans student athletes to compete on school sports teams that align with their gender identities.
title: Justice Department sues California over transgender athlete policies

author: The Associated Press
description: Jannik Sinner used terrific serving and his usual booming forehand to dismiss 10th-seeded Ben Shelton and earn a second appearance in the Wimbledon semifinals.
title: Jannik Sinner beats American Ben Shelton to reach Wimbledon’s semifinals

author: Kevin Breuninger, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday sent letters dictating new U.S. tariff rates on at least seven more countries’ imports, leaning into his aggressive approach to resetting America’s global trade relationships
title: Trump sends more letters dictating high tariff rates around the world

author: Hatzel Vela, NBC South Florida
description: Miami-Dade County Mayor Daniella Levine Cava sent a letter to Florida's attorney general requesting access and monitoring of the detention site, which was built on county land.
title: Families and immigrant detainees allege horrible conditions at 'Alligator Alcatraz'

author: The Associated Press
description: After deadly flooding in central Texas in 1987, some thought they’d proven they could handle Mother Nature’s best punch.
title: U.S. faces more frequent extreme weather events, but attitudes and actions aren't keeping up

author: David K. Li
description: PETA filed a state lawsuit on Tuesday against the American Kennel Club, in hopes of forcing the influential group to ditch breeding standards that allegedly lead to "deformed, unhealthy" canines
title: PETA files suit against American Kennel Club, demanding end to 'deformed' breeding

author: The Associated Press
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif.
title: 13-year-old suspected of setting off fireworks that sparked Southern California wildfire

author: Ken Dilanian
description: Former CIA Director John Brennan and former FBI Director James Comey, two favorite targets of President Trump's, are facing criminal investigations.
title: Trump administration targets Comey and Brennan with new investigation

author: Doha Madani
description: Olivia Munn shared on Wednesday that her mother was diagnosed with and underwent treatment for breast cancer, revealing the news more than a year after the actor announced her own diagnosis.
title: Olivia Munn's mother diagnosed with breast cancer after actor's own cancer diagnosis

author: Jon Gerberg
description: Two days before flash floods on the Guadalupe River in Texas killed dozens of campers at a Christian girls summer camp, a state inspector approved operations, noting there was a written plan for responding to natural disasters.
title: Texas officials approved Camp Mystic's operating plan days before the fatal floods

description: President Trump has announced a new round of tariffs for six countries that include the Philippines, Iraq and Libya. NBC News' Brain Cheung reports on the announcement and the coming tariff negotiation deadline the Trump administration has put in place.
title: Trump announces new round of tariffs for six countries

author: Reuters
description: Accompanied by their newborn son, Michelet and his wife arrived at the St.
title: Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio stand firm as Trump threatens deportation

author: Doha Madani
description: Barbie is expanding its repertoire with the launch of a doll that has Type 1 diabetes and is outfitted with medical devices, such as a wearable insulin pump, commonly used by people with the condition.
title: Mattel launches Barbie with Type 1 diabetes and a glucose monitor

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Yaqeen was conceived in war.
title: Israeli strike kills a 5-month-old girl and her parents in Gaza

author: The Associated Press
description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands — The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants Tuesday for the Taliban's supreme leader and the head of Afghanistan's Supreme Court on charges of persecuting women and girls since seizing power nearly four years ago
title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Taliban leaders over persecution of women and girls

author: The Associated Press
description: The Center for Transyouth Health and Development at Children's Hospital Los Angeles will be closing in response to the Trump administration's threat to cut federal funds to places that offer gender-affirming care to minors.
title: Protesters rally against closure of largest gender-affirming care center for kids in the U.S.

author: Jason Abbruzzese
description: Linda Yaccarino said Wednesday that she will step down as CEO of X, the social media platform owned by Elon Musk.
title: Linda Yaccarino to step down as CEO of X

author: Ronda Racha Penrice
description: Following six Tony nominations and two wins, the Pulitzer Prize-winning family drama “Purpose is losing its on-stage matriarch.
title: Tony-winner 'Purpose' succeeds on the backs of its matriarchs

author: The Associated Press
description: Two people died when huge rocks fell on their vehicle in Guatemala, after more than 37  earthquakes and aftershocks were recorded in a matter of hours on Tuesday.
title: In Guatemala dozens of earthquakes and aftershocks cause two deaths

author: Marina Kopf
description: There are no clear guidelines about how much turmeric is safe to consume and turmeric pills are not approved by the Food and Drug Administration.
title: Woman says NBC News report helped her recognize liver damage from turmeric pills

author: Steve Kopack
description: The AI chipmaker’s market value smashed the previous record valuation, set by Apple.
title: Nvidia becomes the first company to be worth $4 trillion

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin said his family was rescued in the unprecedented floodwaters that killed more than 100 people in central Texas.
title: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin says his family was rescued in Texas floods

author: The Associated Press
description: A Liberian-flagged cargo ship came under fire from Houthi rebels in the Red Sea, with two on board reported to be hurt and two others missing.
title: Ship attacked in the Red Sea after a bulk carrier sinking claimed by Yemen's Houthi rebels

author: The Associated Press
description: Russia fired a record 728 Shahed and decoy drones at Ukraine overnight, as well as 13 cruise and ballistic missiles, the Ukrainian air force said Wednesday.
title: Russia launches another record drone attack, Ukrainian officials say

author: Alexander Smith
description: Humanity’s burning of fossil fuels directly led to the deaths of at least 1,500 people in a European heatwave last week, a landmark study said.
title: Global warming contributed to 1,500 more deaths during Europe's heat wave, study says

author: The Associated Press
description: CHICAGO — A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin “El Chapo” is expected to plead guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges at a Wednesday hearing.
title: Son of 'El Chapo' expected to plead guilty to drug trafficking charges in Chicago

author: Liz Calvario, TODAY
description: Liam Payne’s memory lives on in “Building the Band.”The late One Direction singer makes his final television appearance in the new Netflix singing competition — and fans are tuning in to see his last moments on screen
title: How Liam Payne's death is addressed in 'Building the Band'

description: The president is expected to outline tariffs affecting at least seven more countries if they do not reach trade deals with U.S. by Aug. 1.
title: Trump puts pressure on trade partners as he rolls out additional tariffs

author: Zoe Malin
description: Amazon Prime Day 2 is here! We've searched far and wide and found the best sales worth your money from Apple, Dyson, Kindle and more — updated live.
title: Live: 109+ best deals to shop on day two of Prime Day, according to a shopping writer

author: The Associated Press
description: Patrick Bailey’s entrance into the Major League Baseball record books on Tuesday night began with a tight swing that sent a fastball from Phillies reliever Jordan Romano into Triples Alley.
title: Giants catcher makes history with game-ending, inside-the-park home run

description: Hopes of finding survivors after devastating floods in Texas is fading, but volunteers are refusing to give up despite the odds as more is learned about the known victims. Meanwhile, before-and-after satellite images are showing the scope and scale of the historic disaster. NBC’s Morgan Chesky reports for TODAY.
title: Satellite Images Show Scope of Devastation From Texas Floods

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Meteorologists and forecasting experts say the severity of the deadly Texas floods couldn’t have been predicted.
title: Challenge of predicting Texas floods and  SCOTUS allows for mass federal layoffs: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: PHILADELPHIA — A union representing thousands of city workers in Philadelphia and the city has reached a deal to end a more than weeklong strike that halted residential curbside trash pickup and affected other services, officials said Wednesday
title: Philadelphia workers and city reach a deal to end strike that halted residential trash pickup

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Formula 1 team Red Bull Racing has sacked Christian Horner as the team principal and chief executive after 20 years in charge, it said in a statement Wednesday.
title: Christian Horner sacked by Red Bull after 20 years as principal at F1 team

description: Video captured by an NBC News crew in Gaza shows mourners gathering at Shifa Hospital in Gaza City after a mother, father their and 5-month-old daughter were killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit their apartment. At around the same time, a separate missile struck a nearby car, killing a father and his 14-year-old son.
title: Children killed in multiple Israeli airstrikes on Gaza

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Democrats are putting millions of dollars onto the airwaves in the New Jersey governor’s race, with an outside group making a new major ad reservation.
title: Democrats pour millions into New Jersey governor's race

author: Evan Bush
description: As a succession of thunderstorms fed by the remnants of Tropical Storm Barry pummeled Texas' Hill Country, tools used by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to detect extreme rainfall began “maxing out the color charts.”
title: How a confluence of extreme weather, geography and timing created Texas' flood disaster

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Rural hospitals say they’re being forced to consider tough choices after President Trump signed into law a domestic policy bill that includes cuts to Medicaid and Obamacare.
title: Rural hospitals brace for painful choices after Trump's Medicaid and Obamacare cuts

author: Evie Steele
description: Prices for pet services — like grooming, dog walking and medical care — are rising nearly twice as fast as those for goods like food, leashes and toys.
title: That's a lot of scratch: More pet owners spring for insurance as vet costs climb

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW ORLEANS — An Iranian mother detained by U.S.
title: Iranian mother released from ICE detention after Republican House majority leader intervenes

author: Reuters
description: The Justice Department alleged a team of Chinese hackers tried to access a Covid-19 vaccine being developed by the University of Texas in 2020.
title: Chinese state-sponsored contract hacker arrested in Italy at U.S. request, DOJ says

author: The Associated Press
description: At least 13 people were thought to have taken their own lives as a result of Britain's Post Office scandal, in which almost 1,000 postal employees were wrongly prosecuted or convicted of criminal wrongdoing because of a faulty computer system, a report said Tuesday.
title: At least 13 may have killed themselves over U.K.'s Post Office wrongful convictions scandal

author: Alex Portée
description: The sparkle is back at Windsor Castle
title: Kate Middleton seen in tiara for the first time in nearly 2 years

author: TODAY
description: Former “Love Island USA” contestant Yulissa Escobar is addressing Cierra Ortega’s departure from the show, calling for compassion over cyberbullying
title: 'Love Island USA' star Yulissa Escobar reacts to Cierra Ortega's sudden departure

author: TODAY
description: A shocking death is not a new plot point for “And Just Like That…”The “Sex and the City” spinoff show left many fans reeling with the surprising death of Mr.
title: 'And Just Like That' plot hole explained: Did Lisa Todd Wexley's dad die twice?

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Ruidoso, a New Mexico mountain town hit by devastating wildfires last year, saw dangerous flooding Tuesday after heavy rain fell on areas burned in the blazes, officials said.
title: Flash flood emergency hits New Mexico town that burned in deadly wildfires

author: Jonathan Lloyd, NBC Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES — Hollywood actor Michael Madsen, whose film career spanned decades and included roles in “Reservoir Dogs,” “Kill Bill” and “Donnie Brasco,” died from heart failure, his cardiologist told NBC Los Angeles
title: 'Reservoir Dogs' actor Michael Madsen died from heart failure, doctor says
